website_summaries.verdict: Good-looking gloves by a top name in the industry that can easily be worn for everyday or dressy occasions. However, some size and fit issues have been noted.
pros: The gloves feature an attractive, flexible fit with suede palm and finger pads and soft fleece lining
Moisture-repellent nylon shell is crafted with Lycra that makes the gloves comfortably stretchy
cons: Only available in one size, so the fit may not work for women with very large or small hands
Some reports of stitching coming loose with typical wear

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, fabulous, soft, warm, FITTED gloves
customer_reviews.text: They are SOOOOOO comfy, and fit sooooo well. They cling to your hand like saran wrap; they keep your hands warm like mink. No bulky over stretched fingers; no bulky thick things that you can't feel what you're holding. LADIES -- THESE are PERFECT gloves for us. You WILL NOT regret getting a pair OR TWO.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: After I finished this very cold chore I went to my computer and the above was the best price and the fastest shipping around
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of these gloves. I had a pair for over 8 years but when I needed them this past week when the temp never got above freezing I could only find one glove. I had to defrost my outside front faucet and then install drip hoses to both back and front outside faucets. After I finished this very cold chore I went to my computer and the above was the best price and the fastest shipping around. They arrived yesterday and were exactly like my old pair. The only difference was the price as I paid over $30 for the original pair.
customer_reviews.author: Louan K. Wigton

customer_reviews.title: Keep Shopping
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Isotoner gloves for as long as I can remember. They are warm, fit perfectly, and have never caused a problem. Not these gloves. These are not real Isotoners.They are impossibly small, and on the left glove, I cannot, for the life of me, get my pinky finger into the pinky slot, because of the lining or it is stitched together. They are ridiculously short, and so tight. I am 5'5" and 118 lbs. These should have been a no brainier. They are going back.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Miss the original Isotoner gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I love the brand and have been wearing Isotoner gloves for 30-40 years. My complaint is, I had to get the "one size fits all," when I usually wear large/Extra large. They didn't have that size, so I bought the one size fits all. These gloves are snug. I'm hoping the more I wear them, the more they'll stretch out. Also, the older version of the Isotoner's had a warmer, thicker thermal lining which I loved. This lining is thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Using Less Leather
customer_reviews.text: I would keep shopping as Isotoner has made most of their fleece gloves without a full covering of leather on the bottom. (see photo of a few years back compared to new). This makes them substantially less warm! In addition, the bottom seam was raveled and I had to sew to fix a brand new pair of gloves. Quality is lower than expected. There are other brands with sheep leather for the entire glove that are only a few dollars more. Keep shopping!
customer_reviews.author: J. Noble

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these gloves they come up above the wrist and that was my biggest concern
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: But I'm still happy with them because they are made from a stretch ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a timeless design, which is why I chose them. The fit is a little tight (my hand is just under 7 inches long/ 3 inches wide without thumb/ middle finger is just over 3 inches long) and the fabric bunches here and there. But I'm still happy with them because they are made from a stretch material. I'm thinking that they will likely wear to conform to my hands fairly quickly. The only concern I have is if they will continue to have a little bunch to them after that happens. They will be great for driving in the winter, regardless of look and the lining is very soft and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: NOT smartphone friendly like the manufacturer info says
customer_reviews.text: The "From the manufacturer" section in the listing for these gloves talks about Smart Touch technology and that you can use a smart phone with the gloves on. That was the deciding factor in buying these gloves...and that is INCORRECT. These gloves do not allow you to use a smart phone, the fingertips are too thick. The manufacturer messaging should be updated so that it's not misleading. Even though they're disappointing in that I can't use my phone while my hands are warm, I plan to keep these gloves because they're still very nice...and very warm. No other complaints other than the misleading messaging.
customer_reviews.author: TexasDi

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are working out pretty well! I have arthritis in my hands and I found that all my nice leather, but older gloves were difficult to put on. These are nice and stretchy so it is easier to maneuver them on. They have suede leather patches on the palms for gripping and a fleece lining that is really warm.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila P.

customer_reviews.title: Not good in bad weather
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair I thought I had lost. I later found them, & boy was I glad! Cleaning all the ice off my car in freezing rain in 28 degree temps, the icy rain soaked right through the 3rd & 4th fingers. I had to go in and put on the original pair (which I bought a few years ago), which kept my hands warm & dry. I don't know if they are making these out of cheaper material, but they are definitely not as good.
customer_reviews.author: ljc

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit, good good
customer_reviews.text: Typical Isotoner quality, however fit was tighter than other style Isotoner One Size Fits most. I got these for my wife, who has been loyal to Isotoner for years. This was a slightly different style, longer wrist length and the fit was too tight between the fingers. Returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A.

customer_reviews.title: Fall Basics
customer_reviews.text: Standard Isotoner driving gloves. Stitched well. Every time I lose gloves (a bat habit), I go back to the basics, and these are the only brand I get. I even purchased two pairs this time for when I lose a glove in a few months (probably at a Starbucks if I were psychic).
customer_reviews.author: Grazing Pony in the Pasture

customer_reviews.title: Not warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: I received these gloves yesterday and wore them home and again this morning. My hands were cold the whole time I had them on. They are really small too so they fit tight . I live in snow country and these will not help at all. I would not order these.
customer_reviews.author: lifeinthetetons

customer_reviews.title: Just Like I Remember Them
customer_reviews.text: I had NO IDEA Isotoner was still making gloves but I'm glad they are. These gloves DID NOT disappoint! They fit to form and keep my hands nice and warm. The added bonus of having no slip grips so I can safely hold onto my phone is a huge plus. You'll be VERY PLEASED just remember that these gloves are FIT TO FORM there's not much wiggle room so measure your hands and buy yourself some FANTASTIC GLOVES
customer_reviews.author: Storm  Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: They are OK
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a warm glove that was still sort of sleek and simple. I asked a friend living in Boston, thinking they might know about how to keep warm. Frankly, they are average at best. If you are going to and from your car, they are fine. But if you commute by bus or subway and need to walk - your fingers will get cold. Even walking the dog, they get cold. I'm not sure what climate these are for. I'm in DC - it gets cold, but this isn't the Northeast. Maybe women south of here would like them better! Otherwise, they are comfortable, they look good, they fit nice and snug.
customer_reviews.author: Angela R.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for chilly weather
customer_reviews.text: Very nice as driving gloves. Not super warm but comfortable and provides a barrier from the cold!
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Definitely my favorite brand of gloves
customer_reviews.text: Definitely my favorite brand of gloves. But when I saw them at Sears for $45, I said, "I don't think so...", then drove home to look for them on where else? Amazon! For $20 less. Pleased as ever with these. Warm, comfy, stretchy - all a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Grace

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful comfortable rich looking gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself and one for a gift. They are beautifully made and gorgeous to look at. They look super expensive! They are a little stretchy and comfortable and my hands are a bit large. They are warm enough when there is snow outside. They dress up an outfit so lovely. My friend has smaller hands and absolutely loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: As expected. The only minor issue is that when you first take them out of the plastic packaging there's a weird smell. It may be because of the packaging because once they aired out they were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Mavis

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for the right environment
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these to use in Prague and Budapest in January. The temperature was in the high 20's, low 30's and she used another set of gloves as a base layer under these. As other reviewers have stated these gloves weren't made to keep you warm for extended periods of time so she ended up ditching both pairs of gloves and just keeping Hot Hands in her pockets. With that being said, these gloves were not meant for these temperatures and are not advertised as such. They are attractive, good quality gloves and stretch easily to go over another pair of gloves if needed.
customer_reviews.author: J&N

customer_reviews.title: One size fits all = small and tight
customer_reviews.text: They are OK but I do wonder if they are knock offs. I have really small hands (7 inch palm) and these gloves are tight, and the fingers are just barely long enough. The cuffs seem really short too Something just seems off about them. But, they were cheap so I'll use them this winter and order another pair next year directly from the Isotoner website.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska shopper

customer_reviews.title: Arthritis aids
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to support the circulation in my very arthritic and often cold hands while out walking my physiotherapist (AKA my dog) who in turn forces me to exercise the other arthritic joints in my feet, ankles, knees and hips. The gloves meets my needs admirably as they are lined for warmth, and the stretch as you bend your fingers and hands definitely helps support the arthritic joints and aids in the return of blood flow from the hands. Because the gloves are also washable I don’t worry about the picking up of the curbsiders that the dog deposits should my baggie slip or break. For my needs these gloves are great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great glove for those nippy days.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are a great medium warmth (comfortable for between 30-55 degrees) between the Isotoner Shortie unlined gloves and my thick gloves I use for the below zero days. If you have long fingers or enjoy nails longer than maintenance length, the gloves may not sit in the valley between the fingers. This being said, they are much more forgiving then the typical leather dress glove. I ordered a pair of these for my 26 year old daughter. She has had trouble finding gloves with fingers short enough for her in the past. Generally she would purchase children's gloves but the wrist area of the kids gloves would be too short. These gloves are perfect for her.
customer_reviews.author: Filigree Star

customer_reviews.title: for the price, they're warm enough
customer_reviews.text: These are super cute! They look sleek and great, have a great feel to them. They feel like a more expensive material than what they are. Usually, they provide great warmth. However, in lower temperatures (20-30 fahrenheit), your fingers do get cold. In addition, they also don't have finger sensors. Overall though, for the price, they are of great quality and function great as chilly weather gloves that are cute!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Liu

customer_reviews.title: ugly and worthless
customer_reviews.text: what happen? isotoner used to make a nice leather glove, I had a beautiful pair for many years which were wearing out after 10 years so order these to replace them. these are just nylon uglies not worth 5 dollars. won't be purchasing any more gloves from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Did not like these at all. We bought these for a trip to NYC, so that I would be able to use my phone and not have to worry about taking them off. But they didn’t work AT ALL. They didn’t provide much protection from the cold and Iended up having to remove the gloves in order to use my phone. Really disappointing. They material also seems cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Lo & Maria

customer_reviews.title: TINY GLOVES + No Touch Screen
customer_reviews.text: I have medium size hands as a woman (5'6 135 lbs) and these gloves are so small it was cutting of my circulation. To add salt to the wound it is NOT TOUCH SCREEN gloves. So on top of the fact that they are hard to put on and take off, I was forced to take them off always in order to use my phone. For the price, I am extremely unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: ajk

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: These are okay. My fingers always went numb out in the cold and often had to double up gloves or borrow someone else’s. The touch screen feature worked maybe half the time. I did like the sleekness of the gloves, the color and the fact that they hit your wrists for when your coat sleeves push back.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm, but too small~~
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves as a gift for my mother. They are high-quality and very warm. However, they are too-tight for my mom. She doesn't have big hands...just average, at most. She is wearing them, but they really are too snug. I will find her a glove that offers sizes, rather than one-size-fits-all, and then we'll donate these to the local women's shelter. Hopefully, they will end up with someone who has shorter/more petite sized hands.
customer_reviews.author: ThelmaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Feel great, well made, work with electronics, but only one size
customer_reviews.text: I love isotoners! All of their gloves feel so good as they massage your hands gently while keeping them warm but not hot-just the right temp. They are very well made and you can operate your computer devices and smartphone while wearing them. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 stars is the sizing. With one size fits all there is no way to adjust for large hands or long fingers or long nails. One size normally works since they stretch nicely but not always enough. They are lovely gloves and I would get them again
customer_reviews.author: AnimalLover

customer_reviews.title: Just OK; not good for big hands
customer_reviews.text: These are 'one size fits all' but not if you have large hands for a girl, as I do. They are tight. I believe they'll stretch a little so I'm keeping them. Also the length (up the wrists) is not what I'm accustomed to from Isotoner... they're not 'shorties' but they're shorter than what I've purchased from them in the past. Overall review: just okay, not great.
customer_reviews.author: deskcapades

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! They were exactly what I was looking for. Sleek and snug, warm, not bulky. I don’t know why someone else wrote that they aren’t real Isotoners. Mine arrived attached to cardboard that clearly stated the Isotoner brand. I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Kircher

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this brand for decades. Comfortable for driving which is great. The leather applique grips the steering wheel. My previous pair was all leather so I hesitated on this pair. I am very pleased. Thicker mining than my previous pair.
customer_reviews.author: Normajean l

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT keep my hands warm at all
customer_reviews.text: I tested these on a 30F degree day, which is not nearly as cold as it gets in Central Wisconsin, and within 30 seconds I could feel my fingers getting cold. These might be okay if it’s 50, but for what I need they definitely did NOT fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Terface

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, not as long as expected
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, though this product is advertised as "One Size Fits All," it did not fit comfortably on my hands. The thumb was especially tight. Admittedly, my hands are a little big! I will say that the fingers were nice and long. I hate it when gloves are too short! I docked a second star because I was hoping for gloves that came up a few inches on my wrist, as pictured. They do cover your wrist but they're not nearly as long as the photo would have you believe.
customer_reviews.author: Skates of Wrath

customer_reviews.title: One size does NOT fit all--- best for smaller hands & petite ladies.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were longer and would adequately cover my wrists. However, they didn't fit and were too small. The circumference around the widest part of my hand (at the base of first & pinkie finger knuckles and not including my thumb-- how you properly measure for gloves) is about 8-1/2 inches. I took them to a Christmas party and gave them to a friend (she liked them, but has much smaller hands, so they fit her great).
customer_reviews.author: Kapaea

customer_reviews.title: Fit my small hands well
customer_reviews.text: I have quite small hands, and often wear kids gloves and mittens, but I wanted something a tad bit classier. This is my third pair of Istoners (I lose things all the time) and love these, especially for driving. I also have Raynaud's disease so the lining is greatly appreciated. I don't use these on long hikes out in the cold but they are good for normal daily life in a place that gets cold.
customer_reviews.author: CSE

customer_reviews.title: NOT WARM
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE NICE LOOKING GLOVES. i BOUGHT THEM THINKING BECAUSE OF THE FLEECE LINING THEY WOULD BE WARM. WRONG. THE LINING IS SO THIN THERE IS NO WARMTH. THEY RUN A LITTLE SMALL BUT AFTER WEARING A FEW TIMES THEY STRETCH TO FIT.
customer_reviews.author: grayce

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves, but not good for phones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for the touchscreen feature... but I didn’t read all the questions and reviews that say the touchscreen feature in the item description doesn’t work. I think the seller should remove all mention of that. I certainly did not work on my iPhone. They’re very nice gloves. They were only $10 so I’m not going to bother returning them even though I STILL need to buy gloves that are actually touchscreen compatible.
customer_reviews.author: nd

customer_reviews.title: Had the same pair for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. I've washed them in the washer several times (only drip dried though). They fit tight; I have small hands, so they may not fit everyone. I like them for driving and cleaning the snow off of the car. However, they don't warm up my hands very well. I'll probably get a fleece lined pair next time.
customer_reviews.author: The Good Wife

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: They run small and I have a medium sized women hand, so it shouldn't be so tight. They have an inner lining that is loose so every time you put them on or take them off it's a lot of adjusting. They also do not have cell phone touch screen abilities. Cell phone touch screens are usually heat censored and two layers of material will block that. Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: La Blue

customer_reviews.title: Snug but comfy
customer_reviews.text: As stated in other reviews, these are snug. My hands are not large nor pudgy by any means, although I also do not have super thin and delicate hands either. These fit a little bit more snugly than I would like, but they are still comfortable to wear and drive in. I am thinking that they might relax after I've had a chance to wear them for awhile and break them in. All in all I am satisfied with my purchase. They keep my hands warm!
customer_reviews.author: CillaChaos

customer_reviews.title: Love them, and would never buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a replacement for my existing gloves. Love them, and would never buy anything else. My old gloves were the same, though bought at half the price from the local Burlington Coat Factory. They lasted me a good 5 years, before I lost one of the gloves from the pair. These fit well, keep me warm and do not get wet. One problem - they are not "mobile" friendly so in winters I have to remove if i want to use the cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Hand comfort for colder weather.
customer_reviews.text: On receiving the Isotoner gloves, I tried them on and was quite pleased at the fit and comfort as well as the finger support of the gloves. I have always, as long as possible, obtained Isotoner gloves when needed and I am quite pleased with these at this time. They also wear well.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene A. Stockel

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves that fit right and made well
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They don’t stop right at the wrist like sooo many here I’ve ordered. They’re big enough for non-petite hands. The thickness is just right for cold but not really cold weather. And they’re well-made. I’ll be ordering another color!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Whimsy

customer_reviews.title: Well made and very warm
customer_reviews.text: I think Isotoner gloves are really nice. I also have a pair of unlined gloves for weather a bit warmer than our sub-zero spell! My only wish is that you would have had a better choice on the sizing. One Size is just too short for my long fingers and the old arthritis is starting to swell my hands. I did give them to an older neighbor (in her 90's) and they fit fine when she remembers to wear them, and they do keep her hands very warm. I did have to find a L/XL pair.
customer_reviews.author: mna

customer_reviews.title: Warm, flexible and cost effective!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are warm and very flexible. I love them. They are somewhat too silky looking for my jackets but I keep losing gloves that I need to remove for tasks like writing to check or similar needs. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Maiolo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: My hands, fingers, and knuckles have swollen with arthritis through the years. I was afraid these wouldn't fit, but they're perfect. They're a little snug, but I know they will stretch a little with time. Old favorites that are still great.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Don't work with smartphones
customer_reviews.text: They don't work with touch screens at all don't waste your money for your console have to take them off
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Mary

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Since its May, I really can't try these gloves out well enough to give an accurate rating. But I did try them on and they seem fine. I was worried about the "one size" fitting my larger hands but they were the normal snug that I like with the Isotoners. Everything seems fine about them. Workmanship seems fine. Fabric and color seems fine. They have an Isotoner label inside.
customer_reviews.author: dogcomp

customer_reviews.title: Good compromise between comfort and looks
customer_reviews.text: I always hated how gloves looked non-feminine so this one was a real deal for me. They are a lot cuter and more delicate than most of the ones you'll find out there. I do feel that there are more sewing than necessary (and as I used those, sewing thread ruptured in many spots so I had to re-sew them).
customer_reviews.author: Paula Cristina Nicioli

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great fitting glove, soft liner, warm. . . I'm a photographer and couldn't find photo gloves that fit like the Isotoner, so got these and cut a slit in the thumb and index finger, fold them back when photographing, and keep them covered when not photographing.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Ingalls

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time, great quality as always.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Isotoner gloves for 40 years and they never fail me. used one pair for over ten years and they still look pretty good - no stitch breakage, and only slight pilling. I expect this new pair to perform the same.
customer_reviews.author: Robin A Reid

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are in no way, shape, fashion or form the same as the high quality Isotoner's that I have purchased in the past. They appear to be cheaply made; and although being sold as "one size (fits all?)", they are WAY too tight (which is something that I have never encountered with previous purchases of similar gloves). Instead of returning them, I suppose I'll just chalk it up as money wasted and not make the same mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: sourpuss29

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these for about a month- love them. They are classy and nice looking. Won't keep yours hands warm enough in VERY cold winter weather, but these are perfect for hands that get cold easily or for cold fall days.I have long, thin fingers and overall pretty large hands because of the length of my fingers, and these just fit. (they fit well). I recommend :).
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not the real Isotoner gloves. These are knockoffs ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not the real Isotoner gloves. These are knockoffs. However, these held up well in the snow and kept my hands warm. I live in New England, so temperatures can be as low as 20 degrees Fahrenheit in the winter. My hands are tiny, and I find them kind of tight. So if you have big hands, don't buy. Overall these are a great alternative to the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Jo

customer_reviews.title: snug warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and warm gloves- leather palm (I don't think that was mentioned in the description). They fit well but I have long thin fingers. I think a person with 'chubbier' fingers would definitely have a difficult time putting these on. I have to work at getting them on but, once on they fell very good. The fleece lining will make these good a warm on a cold winter day.
customer_reviews.author: smartshopper

customer_reviews.title: the Isotoner Womens fashon Stretch I got for my daughter were very nice. Oh
customer_reviews.text: I don't mean to bash the seller because it arrived on time. I bought these for my sister on Jan 6, 2018 and gave them to her for her birthday February 10th. They were defective and the pinky on both gloves were practically sewn up they were so tight. I missed the return cutoff so I'm stuck with them. If you buy them try on right away in case you run into the same problem. the Isotoner Womens fashon Stretch I got for my daughter were very nice. Oh well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They run small and aren’t very stretchy.
customer_reviews.text: I can barely get them on my hands. I don’t have large hands either. They are so tight I can’t wear them. I have Isotoner Gloves for years. None of them are tight like these are. I wanted to love them. Other than size they are nice. I usually wear medium gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jobeth

customer_reviews.title: Only for extremely skinny fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the reviews saying how tight the fingers were. My daughter has extremely delicate, skinny fingers and hands, like child's hands really. These were STILL tight on her! But she likes them, so they get 4 stars. Beware if you have normal to large fingers, there's no way on earth these will fit normal sized hands.
customer_reviews.author: Marana

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do not keep me warm in Washington DC, also the pad does not work on a iphone 8,
customer_reviews.author: Gail Neal

customer_reviews.title: Very classy and chić💕
customer_reviews.text: I’ve needed gloves due to dealing with brutal Midwest winters but just any gloves wouldn’t do. I’m so glad to have found these! Not only do they protect my hands from the intense cold but they look so classy paired with my coats. I feel even more sophisticated with these on.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Nesiri

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves will buy again! However, not Isotoners!
customer_reviews.text: I loved these gloves. They are attractive. However, not real Isotoner. I will buy another pair. As long as they are comfortable and attractive I am not worried about the Brand..
customer_reviews.author: Marci Knowles

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL GLOVES AND WARM TOO!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with my Isotoner Women's Stretch Classic Fleece-lined gloves. They are exactly what I was looking for. The material is stretchy and ensures a perfect fit and because they are trimmed in leather in the palm and fingers, it allows you to grip the steering wheel like high-end driving gloves. I would definitely recommend them to my sister-friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee Woods

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little snug
customer_reviews.text: I measured my hand before ordering these to get the right size. They fit but are kind of snug. I guess the other reviewers were right. Hope they stretch a little with wear. Great gloves otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Tippy2

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves for driving
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are not bulky as some others, however the fleece lining makes them incredibly warm. They fit snugly on your hand but not so tight that it makes it difficult to move. I love these gloves for driving. They are not the type of gloves that would be suitable for playing in the snow perhaps, but again that was not the reason for the purchase. They look nice as well, making them suited to even formal attire.
customer_reviews.author: earthmama

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic "non-touch" gloves
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for some non-conductive gloves for about two years . . . kept checking amazon and other websites. When I saw these were in stock, I jumped on them. So glad I did. They fit pretty well (isotoner fingers are usually a little long for me), and they are reasonably warm.
customer_reviews.author: eloisebig

customer_reviews.title: These would make a great gift but they are not as warm as I ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a classy pair of women's gloves that you can wear with a dressy coat or with a regular down coat. These would make a great gift but they are not as warm as I remember them to be so I deducted one star. These would work for the fall but not for full winter.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Scully

customer_reviews.title: Not like ones in the store
customer_reviews.text: They are not comfortable and unable to use my phone with them on.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Green

customer_reviews.title: Small even for my small hands
customer_reviews.text: These were a little too small and my hands are very small which usually makers it hard for me to buy gloves. Also, the fleece lining want very fleecy so they weren't very warm. Most disappointing is that the finger linings would pull out when I took the gloves of. Not the quality I expected from Isotoner
customer_reviews.author: Day Hiker

customer_reviews.title: European weather in October
customer_reviews.text: Have tried these on but not put them to the test. Needed something light and flexible for hoisting luggage and sightseeing, even bought a headband just in case. Not sure if the high of 60 degrees is the same as 60 degrees here but I know the 40 and 50 degrees are enough to require gloves hence the fleece lined.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Isotoner gloves always meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Isotoner gloves for decades and continue to be a fan. They are comfortable, washable and even function as a first layer when the cold demands more than one pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Lodwick

customer_reviews.title: Way too tight fitting
customer_reviews.text: They are too tight fitting. This really prevents them from keeping your hands warm. Gloves need to have a little slack. Maybe if they are size choices it might be better
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST GLOVES EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! -- They fit so comfortably, look casual or dressy and are really warm! I have warn them for years and just recently lost one of the gloves. Thank goodness they are still available on line. I will always make sure I have a spare pair! The Best!!
customer_reviews.author: BMHRtlc

customer_reviews.title: Other than that they are fine fit well
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced. Need to shop a round on items before purchasing through Amazon. Found the same gloves in Walmart Isotoner for 9.99 also in TJMaxx and in Kohls. I jumped the gun on these. Other than that they are fine fit well, look like the picture and are fleeced lined.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Size Fits Most Not All
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these gloves were simply too tight around my knuckles. Bending my fingers was a challenge also. These gloves are lovely but they miss the mark, significantly in terms of their stretch. The fleece, however, is quite warm and soft. Bigger hands with long fingers and wide knuckle spans are not well suited for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kiara

customer_reviews.title: it feels nice and seems to keep my hand warm
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's because I'm right-handed that the right-hand glove is a little bit more snug than the left-hand. I have small hands, I think, so if you have big hands, you might not want to purchase these. Otherwise, it feels nice and seems to keep my hand warm. I bought it for driving in the morning during the winter. I don't know how they are yet in snow.
customer_reviews.author: LPR

customer_reviews.title: Not a winter weather glove.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a glove that was fleece lined and wsrmer them most glioves. This was not the glove that I thought it would be. It was too thin and there was not enough fleece inside to provide adequate warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: If they only were not so tight and small
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could wear isotoner but my hands swell all the time these were super soft and nice looking but I couldn't get them on. Thank you for accepting returns.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Erin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly..
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for gardening..and have done for 20 yrs..beats those awful gardening gloves u get at gardening centers..Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D Collins

customer_reviews.title: Was not happy the second time the wife used them one of ...
customer_reviews.text: Was not happy the second time the wife used them one of the fingers got a hole in it very displeased have always had good stuff from Isotoner
customer_reviews.author: DjH61

customer_reviews.title: Super soft
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my sister and she loves them! She said they are really soft and comfortable. Best part she can still use her phone while wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Quimby Langer

customer_reviews.title: Snug
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great. I gave it a four because they are truly one size fits “most”. My hands are a little bigger than some and they fit snug.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Fallon

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a knock off. Once again I get what I paid for. They are tight on my large hands but usable. Not sure how long they will last, stitching looks pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. There are warm and light-weight. This is not my first pair. I wouldn't have to buy more, if I could just stop losing them...lol
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Isotoner gloves since I was a teenager...I’m 43 now. I’ve never had any complaints about these. They’ve always been the best. The only reason I’m rebuying them is my others seemed to have disappeared. Guess someone needed them more than me. Otherwise I had the same pair for over ten years. They last, and they are warm and not bulky. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Tracey E. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Okay quality but much tighter than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I like them. The quality is decent and what I would expect from this brand. I do find them to be unusually tight with not a ton of stretch. I have owned this brand in the past and I feel like that had more stretch. My hands are average size. Probably medium in ladies gloves and I felt like they were just short of cutting off circulation in my fingers. I'm keeping them but hope the stretch a bit more over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my bike rides
customer_reviews.text: Love the gloves. Fit great. I was worried they would be to big because it's one size and I have small hands , but they fit really snug
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, soft
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, soft, fit well, warm, stylish. Bought these basically for walking into and out of work and driving in this cold Maine weather. Look nice and fair price. I'm glad I bought them, have used them all winter. I think you could use them to shovel or brush your car off, but I don't think they are really made for that.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Fit and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are exactly as expected. The fleece lining is not too heavy or bulky, yet keeps your hands warm. I have been wearing Isotoner gloves for decades. Not only are the prices competitive with Amazon - they were delivered to my door. I'm ordering another pair for next year.
customer_reviews.author: Just us!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a second skin. Perfect for work (driver) moderate warmth. Live in AZ so just what I wanted for those early mornings in the winter. Works well texting too.
customer_reviews.author: Nora ONeil

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up, seam came undone after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for two months, frequent wear, probably 5 - 6 days a week, twice a day. Chicago winters. The hem on the opening of the left glove has already come undone. So now the lining is not connected to the outside of the glove, and it's really awkward to put them on. I've bought Isotoner's in the past, and I definitely won't buy this kind again.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves except no smart touch
customer_reviews.text: The bad: These do not allow you to use touch screens. I thought they did when I ordered. The Good: I have small hands and the small fits perfectly. They are sleek, stylish and warm. Not SUPER warm but for driving, running errands etc in the winter perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DiscoYoga

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: This type of Isotoner has been my go to driving glove for the cold season. With fat, small, hands, the stretch provides comfort while the light lining provides warmth. The updated tech touch makes them new and improved this season.
customer_reviews.author: Frances E

customer_reviews.title: Not so small that I can't use them but they are not comfortable. The fingers are a little short and because ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have large hands and these gloives are small on me. Not so small that I can't use them but they are not comfortable. The fingers are a little short and because they are tight I feel like I'm getting a hand workout trying to make a fist. They are all made though slid your hands are small I'd give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT expect to warm your hands with these.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look great BUT they do NOT warm my hands at all. A disposable pair of latex gloves warm my hands better than these. I had them in my shopping cart for months and when it started getting cold again finally bought them... so sad.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vela

customer_reviews.title: Soft, Comfortable, Warm Gloves ~ Great For Gift Giving, Too
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to give as a gift & the person I bought them for loves them. She lost the right glove of the last pair she had but says that these are even softer & more comfortable than the last ones.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine K.

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my wife.
customer_reviews.text: She loves these gloves. She wanted some driving gloves and these are exactly what she wanted. It gets cold where we live and these keep her hands warm.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Schirmer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these! These are exactly what I wanted. Thin enough no bulk but warm enough, nice stretch, gripper pads on the palm and first two fingers. Excellent! Great price! And just in time because we had our first snow fall today. :)
customer_reviews.author: pip

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Nice warm gloves. My hands are medium to large, and when my hands swell these are tight. My daughter has slightly longer fingers and cannot wear these at all. For me and my purposes(driving, walking) these work well.
customer_reviews.author: JPax

product_meta.title: isotoner Women’s Spandex Cold Weather Stretch Gloves with Warm Fleece Lining
product_meta.description:
Keep warm without compromising your style with isotoner Women’s Spandex Gloves with Fleece Lining. These stretchable gloves incorporate spandex that perfectly contour with your hands for a custom fit and superior flexibility. Chic draw detail on the back of each glove offers sophisticated style that transitions seamlessly between work and a night out, and the cozy fleece lining wraps your hands in supreme warmth on those cold winter days and night, Bullet feature 1 (optional) : Classic spandex stretch gloves for maximum flexibility and movement plus warmth, style, and comfort




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :4 x 1 x 11 inches; 1.76 Ounces
 * Item model number :A21524BLK1SZ
 * Department :Womens
 * Date First Available :January 6, 2011
 * Manufacturer :Totes Women's Accessories
 * ASIN :B0149BJAWE

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #42,405 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #20738 inWomen's Shops 
    *  #14 inWomen's Cold Weather Gloves 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.5 out of 5 stars2,308 ratings Keep warm without compromising your style with isotoner Women’s Spandex Gloves with Fleece Lining. These stretchable gloves incorporate spandex that perfectly contour with your hands for a custom fit and superior flexibility. Chic draw detail on the back of each glove offers sophisticated style that transitions seamlessly between work and a night out, and the cozy fleece lining wraps your hands in supreme warmth on those cold winter days and night, Bullet feature 1 (optional) : Classic spandex stretch gloves for maximum flexibility and movement plus warmth, style, and comfort
feature_bullets: Shell: 85% Nylon, 15% Lycra Spandex; Lining: 100% Polyester
Stay warm: Classic contoured spandex stretch gloves for maximum flexibility and movement. Warm, stylish and comfortable perfect for your active life.
Stay active: Soft stretch fleece lining provides a custom fit with superior warmth during the winter season.
Stay dry: Our signature stretch fabric is specially treated to repel snow and rain so your hands stay dry.
Chic look: Sleek and classically styled with chic detailing is perfect for work or a night on the town.
Care instructions: hand wash cool, no bleach. Air dry flat. Do not tumble dry, iron, or dry clean
